ribbon.title: Openings
ribbon.description: The Computational Multiphysics Research Group (CoMPhys Lab) focuses on developing advanced computational models to study complex thermomechanical systems involving moving boundaries, multiphase interactions, and high strain-rate physics. Our research spans a broad range of applications—from bioinspired flight and cardiovascular flows to droplet evaporation, energetic material dynamics, and hypersonic reentry physics.

sections.title: Graduate Positions (PhD / MS) – Openings from January 2025
sections.description: We are inviting applications for PhD and MS positions in the following research thrusts:
points: Bioinspired Flows: Modeling unsteady aerodynamics in insect flight and cardiovascular systems.
Energetic Material Dynamics: Simulating detonation, shock initiation, and reactive flow behavior in energetic systems.
Hypersonic Reentry Physics: Capturing aerothermal loads, ablation dynamics, and gas-surface interactions in reentry environments.
High Strain-Rate Material Response: Studying deformation and failure under dynamic thermo-mechanical loading conditions.
AI-Driven Multi-Scale Modeling: Developing machine learning-enhanced solvers for multiscale physical systems.
info: 📩 Eligibility: Applicants with strong backgrounds in Aerospace, Mechanical, Applied Physics, or related fields.

sections.title: Undergraduate Research Internships
